metadata.title: Thursday, 20th February, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a) when the Mumbezhi Bridge, which connects Senior Chief Mukumbi’s Palace to Kalengelenge Border via Kalengelenge Basic School, will be rehabilitated;
(b) what has caused the delay in rehabilitating the Bridge; and
(c) what the estimated cost of rehabilitation is.

questions.minister: Minister of Health
parts: (a) when Lufwanyama District Hospital will be opened to the public; and
(b) why it has taken long to open the Hospital.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans of tarring the Kasempa-Mumbwa Road;
(b) if there are such plans, who the contractor is; and
(c) when bridges will be built across the two rivers on the Kasempa-Mumbwa Road.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a) whether the Government is aware that the Solwezi-Kipushi road in Solwezi East Parliamentary Constituency is in a deplorable state of disrepair;
(b) if so, when the road will be rehabilitated;
(c) whether the road is part of the 8000 Link Zambia Project; and
(d) if not, why it was left out of the Project.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a) how long the process of upgrading the 220 basic schools to secondary schools country-wide will take;
(b) whether the process of upgrading the schools will result in interruption of service delivery;
(c) what will happen to the pupils in grades 1-7 at basic schools earmarked for upgrading;
(d) what the benefits of upgrading the schools are, as opposed to constructing new ones; and
(e) how many secondary and primary schools, country-wide, are required to ensure that all eligible learners are in school.

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry
parts: (a) when the Government will facilitate the construction of mango processing plants in Western Province and other parts of the Country where the mango fruit is in abundance; and
(b) whether there are other benefits of the mango fruit besides eating it and, if so, what the benefits are.

questions.minister: Minister of Labour and Social Security
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to create the position of Assistant Labour Commissioner in the North-Western Province;
(b) if so, when; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Health
parts: (a) how many houses for nurses at Gwembe District Hospital will be constructed in 2014;
(b) what the estimated cost of constructing the houses is; and
(c) whether a contractor has already been identified and, if so, what the name of the contractor is.

questions.minister: Minister of Information and Broadcasting
parts: (a) how much money the Zambia National Broadcasting Corporation raised through television licence levy from 2011 to 2013, year by year; and
(b) how much money at (a) above was collected through:
(i) the ZESCO Limited metering system; and (ii) direct debit from salaries or allowances of Government employees.

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry what benefit Zambia has derived from the African Growth and Opportunity Act and the Economic Partnership Agreements.
Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a) what plans the Government has for the piece of land on Thabo Mbeki Road and opposite the National Assembly Members’ Motel, in Lusaka;
(b) how much money will be spent on developing the piece of land above;
(c) whether a contractor for the project has already been identified and, if so, what the name of the contractor is;
(d) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(e) what the time-frame for undertaking the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a) how many teachers’ houses and 1 x 3 classroom blocks are earmarked for construction in 2014 in the following Parliamentary Constituencies:
(i) Lubansenshi; and (ii) Lupososhi; and
(b) what the names of the schools that will benefit from the construction of new classroom blocks, are.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to compel business houses in the extractive industry to help develop areas where they extract natural resources and contribute a percentage of their profits to the Environmental Protection Fund, as part of their corporate social responsibility; and
(b) if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a) how many basic schools in Lundazi District will be upgraded to secondary schools as a result of the newly introduced education policy; and
(b) when construction of infrastructure to support the new education policy will commence in the District, constituency by constituency.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the Government will rehabilitate the Myooye and Nachibila bridges in Nangoma Parliamentary Constituency.
Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a) why the Government has not disbursed funds for the completion of the construction of the Kabanga Health Centre in Mapatizya Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) when the funds will be disbursed; and
(c) who the contractor for the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a) when the construction of Munyumbwe High School in Gwembe District will be completed and opened to the public;
(b) what the total cost of the project is;
(c) what the staff establishment for the School is; and
(d) how many pupils will be enrolled at the School.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing when Luwingu District Council will be provided with funds for improving water and sanitation services in the District.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a) which company was contracted to rehabilitate the drainage along the road from Hybrid Poultry Farm to the LASF Housing Complex in Chamba Valley in Lusaka;
(b) what the contract sum for the project was;
(c) how much money has since been paid to the contractor;
(d) why the works have been abandoned with heaps of gravel on the road; and
(e) when the rehabilitation works will be resumed and completed.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a) when infrastructure development at Zimba District Centre and Kabanga Sub-Administrative Centre will commence;
(b) why Zimba District has two administrative centres;
(c) who determines the geographical positioning of an administrative centre;
(d) what the population of the newly created Zimba District is, ward by ward;
(e) what the distance between Kamukeza near the Zambia/Zimbabwe border and Zimba Administrative Centre is; and
(f) what the distance between Kamukeza and Kabanga Sub-Administrative Centre is.
